definition: slow/unhurried/sluggish/gradual/not tense/relaxed/to postpone/to defer/to stall/to stave off/to revive/to recuperate

sentences.english: Still, Japan quickly suspended imports of American long-grain rice.
sentences.chinese: 日本立即做出反应，暂缓对美国长粒大米的进口。

sentences.english: The weather is such that we had better not plant out the flowers for some time.
sentences.chinese: 这样的天气，我们还是暂缓把花移种出去。

sentences.english: A pause in the breakneck growth of yuan deposits may be a relief to some.
sentences.chinese: 人民币存款疾速增长的暂缓可能让一些人舒了口气。

sentences.english: A by-product of this halt to blood-flow is the temporary backup of blood.
sentences.chinese: 血液暂缓流动的附带结果之一即为血液的暂时淤积。

sentences.english: Some people are calling for a  moratorium on the production of bio-fuels.
sentences.chinese: 一些人呼吁暂缓生产生物燃料。

sentences.english: Beijing has imposed a moratorium on new foreign films.
sentences.chinese: 北京暂缓了所有海外电影的上映档期。

sentences.english: Another action that he took was to suspend the right of habeas corpus.
sentences.chinese: 林肯总统所采取的另一行动是暂缓执行人身保护权令。

sentences.english: This was probably a factor in the Myitsone dam decision.
sentences.chinese: 这可能也是促进暂缓密松大坝决定的一个因素。

sentences.english: However, don’t mistake this as an excuse for shelving schema validation.
sentences.chinese: 不过请别把这个误解成暂缓使用模式验证的借口。

sentences.english: There are still some things that we’re holding back.
sentences.chinese: 不过还是有些东西我们目前是暂缓执行的。

sentences.english: A fourth subsidiary entered into a deferred prosecution agreement.
sentences.chinese: 第四家附属公司达成暂缓起诉协议。

definition: to cease/to suspend/to break off/to stop/to discontinue
to tidy up/to reorganize/to consolidate/to rectify
to present/to give/to hand over/to hand in/to lay before
